result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel G. Metoxen was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery by Prisoners, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.20(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary. Mental Health Treatment

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daniel G. Metoxen

defendant.name: Metoxen, Daniel G.
defendant.address: Inmate Daniel Metoxen Rock County Jail  200 E US H, Janesville, WI 53546

records.addlTxt:
Activity:Plea and Sentencing 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

02:31 PM Defendant Daniel G. Metoxen in court in custody by zoom video with attorney Shanna Sanders in person.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared for the State of Wisconsin by zoom video.  Defendant waives right to appear in person in courtroom. Defendant pleads guilty. Court finds the defendant guilty. PSI Waived.  Court orders sentence withheld; 4 years probation with conditions,   Complete any assessment/treatment/counseling deemed necessary., Mental Health Treatment, Costs due June 17 2022. 89 Days Credit. Felony rights given to defendant.
Order for Collection of a Biological Specimen for DNA Analysis at Conviction
records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: Calendar call on April 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Activity: Status conference 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

8:33 AM Defendant Daniel G. Metoxen in court by video in custody with attorney Shanna Sanders by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  Status conference scheduled for April 12, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on March 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Activity: Preliminary hearing and arraingment  
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

10:29 AM Defendant Daniel G. Metoxen in court in custody by video with attorney Shanna Knueppel by video.  Mary Elizabeth Bricco appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy Allen Peters sworn in and testified. Witness identifed Defendant. State moves for bind over, defense objects without argument.  Court finds probable cause and binds Defendant over for filing of an Information.  Information filed, copy to Defendant, reading waived.  Defendant pleads not guilty and matter scheduled to follow 21CF920. Status conference scheduled for March 15, 2022 at 8:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on February 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity:Adjourned initial appearance 
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

03:31 PM Defendant Daniel G. Metoxen in court by video with attorney Shanna Knueppel by video.  Mason C Braunschweig and Margaret Ginocchio appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Preliminary hearing requested by zoom.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 8, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Activity: Initial appearance
Appearances by video/zoom: Court Official, Court Reporter, Court Clerk, and all Parties referenced in hearing minutes as in court.

3:02 PM Defendant Daniel G. Metoxen in court in custody at the Rock County Jail by video with attorney Walter Isaacson.  Alexander David Goulart appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Complaint filed, copy to defendant, charges and penalties advised, rights given, reading waived.  Cash bond set of $500.00 with conditions.
